Antonio:
Before we get started with Unit 2, let’s run through a quick review. In Unit 1, we looked at the formula for lifestyle related health problems. We learned our biology plus our choices determine whether or not we’ll develop alcoholism or addiction. Biology sets the trigger level, but our choices make the difference.
We also learned the definition of a standard drink is .6 ounce of pure alcohol (which is a little more than 1/2 of an ounce) The “0-1-2-3 Guidelines” for preventing health and impairment problems mean having no more than 1 drink per hour; no more than 2 daily; no more than 3 drinks on any given day; and again, 0 is the only low-risk choice for those with alcoholism.
In this unit, we’re going to learn more about how our choices affect us. To get started, I’d like you to take a few minutes to answer some questions.
